original: Majjhima Nikāya 75
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Māgaṇḍiyasutta
analyzed: māgaṇḍiyasutta
translated: With Māgaṇḍiya

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kurūsu viharati kammāsadhammaṁ nāma kurūnaṁ nigamo, bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agyāgāre tiṇasanthārake.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kurūsu viharati kammāsadhammam nāma kurūnam nigamaḥ bhāradvāja gottassa brāhmaṇassa agya āgāre tiṇa santhārake
translated: Once the Buddha was staying in the Kuru country at a town of the Kurus named Kammāsadamma, in an open, roofed pavilion.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya kammāsadhammaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.🔽Kammāsadhammaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena aññataro vanasaṇḍo tenupasaṅkami divāvihārāya.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya kammāsadhammam piṇḍāya pāvisi  kamma asadhammam piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ yena aññataraḥ vana saṇḍo tena upasaṅkami divāvihārāya
translated: In the morning the Buddha put on his robe and took his bowl and went into Kammāsadamma for alms. 🔽After his meal, when he had returned from alms round, he went to a certain grove for the day’s meditation.

original: Taṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.🔽Atha kho māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako jaṅghāvihāraṁ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agyāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: tam vana saṇḍam ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi  atha kho māgaṇḍiyaḥ paribbājakaḥ jaṅghāvihāram anucaṅkamamānaḥ anuvicaramānaḥ yena bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agyāgāram tena upasaṅkami
translated: After his midday meal he entered that grove and sat down at the root of a certain tree for the day’s meditation. 🔽Then, as Māgaṇḍiya was wandering and walking for exercise, he went to the brahmin Bhāradvāja’s fire chamber.

original: Addasā kho māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agyāgāre tiṇasanthārakaṁ paññattaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho māgaṇḍiyaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhāradvāja gottassa brāhmaṇassa agya āgāre tiṇa santhārakam paññatta
translated: He saw the straw mat laid out in the brahmin’s fire chamber.

original: Disvāna bhāradvājagottaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna bhāradvāja gottam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: and asked the brahmin of the Bharadvaja clan:

original: “kassa nvayaṁ bhoto bhāradvājassa agyāgāre tiṇasanthārako paññatto, samaṇaseyyānurūpaṁ maññe”ti?
analyzed: kassa nu ayam bhoto bhāradvājassa agya āgāre tiṇa santhārako paññatto samaṇa seyyā anurūpam maññeti
translated: “Whose straw mat is this in your fire chamber, brahmin? It seems to be suitable for an ascetic to lie down on.”

original: “Atthi, bho māgaṇḍiya, samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito.
analyzed: atthi bho māgaṇḍiya samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ
translated: “There is, Master Magandiya, an ascetic named Gotama, a son of the Sakyans, gone forth from the Sakyan clan.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: Now a good report of that Master Gotama has been spread to this effect:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘That Blessed One is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: Tassesā bhoto gotamassa seyyā paññattā”ti.🔽“Duddiṭṭhaṁ vata, bho bhāradvāja, addasāma;
analyzed: tassa isā bhoto gotamassa seyyā paññattā ati  duddiṭṭham vata bho bhāradvāja addasāma
translated: His bed has been prepared.”🔽“We have seen what is ill seen, Master Bharadvaja,

original: duddiṭṭhaṁ vata, bho bhāradvāja, addasāma.
analyzed: duddiṭṭham vata bho bhāradvāja addasāma
translated: we have seen what is ill seen.

original: Ye mayaṁ tassa bhoto gotamassa bhūnahuno seyyaṁ addasāmā”ti.🔽“Rakkhassetaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṁ;
analyzed: ye mayam tassa bhoto gotamassa bhūnahuno seyyam addasāma ati  rakkhasseta māgaṇḍiya vāca
translated: We have seen the bed of that Master Gotama, the accomplished and fully enlightened one.”🔽“Guard your tongue, Magandiya,

original: rakkhassetaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṁ.
analyzed: rakkhasseta māgaṇḍiya vāca
translated: guard your tongue, Magandiya.

original: Bahū hi tassa bhoto gotamassa khattiyapaṇḍitāpi brāhmaṇapaṇḍitāpi gahapatipaṇḍitāpi samaṇapaṇḍitāpi abhippasannā vinītā ariye ñāye dhamme kusale”ti.🔽“Sammukhā cepi mayaṁ, bho bhāradvāja, taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ passeyyāma, sammukhāpi naṁ vadeyyāma:
analyzed: bahū hi tassa bhoto gotamassa khattiya paṇḍitā api brāhmaṇa paṇḍitā api gahapati paṇḍitā api samaṇa paṇḍitā api abhippasannāḥ vinītāḥ ariye ñāye dhamme kusalā iti  sammukhā ced ipi bho bhāradvāja tam bhavantam gotamam passeyyāma sammukhā api nam vadeyyāma
translated: For many learned nobles, brahmins, householders, and contemplatives have deep confidence in Master Gotama and are well-instructed in his message, which is well-expounded, aimed at separation, leading to peace, leading to awakening, leading to perfect wisdom, to Nibbana.”🔽“If we were to see Master Gotama face to face, we would say to him:

original: ‘bhūnahu samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: bhūnahu samaṇaḥ gotama uti
translated: ‘Surely, Master Gotama is a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha!

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: Evañhi no sutte ocaratī”ti.
analyzed: evam hi no sutte ocarati iti
translated: Because that is how it appears to us in the scriptures.’“

original: “Sace taṁ bhoto māgaṇḍiyassa agaru āroceyyāmi taṁ samaṇassa gotamassā”ti.
analyzed: sace tam bhotaḥ māgaṇḍiyassa agaru āroceyyāmi tam samaṇassa gotamassa ati
translated: “If it would not be troublesome for you, I would like to inform Master Gotama of this.”

original: “Appossukko bhavaṁ bhāradvājo vuttova naṁ vadeyyā”ti.
analyzed: appossukkaḥ bhavam bhāradvājaḥ vuttaḥ uva nam vadeyya iti
translated: “Master Bhāradvāja should speak as he feels inspired.”

original: Assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa māgaṇḍiyena paribbājakena saddhiṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkanta mānusikāya bhāradvāja gottassa brāhmaṇassa māgaṇḍiyena paribbājakena saddhim imam kathā sallāpa
translated: With his superhuman divine eye, the Buddha heard the conversation between the brahmin of the Bhāradvāja clan and the wanderer Māgandiya.

original: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agyāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā nisīdi bhagavā paññatte tiṇasanthārake.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ yena bhāradvāja gottassa brāhmaṇassa agya āgāram tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā nisīdi bhagavā paññatte tiṇa santhārake
translated: Then, when it was evening, the Blessed One rose from meditation and went to the brahmin of the Bharadvaja clan’s fire chamber, where he sat down on a seat laid out,

original: Atha kho bhāradvājagotto brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhāradvāja gottaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: and the brahmin of the Bharadvaja clan went to the Blessed One, and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho bhāradvājagottaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam khalu bhāradvājagottam brāhmaṇam bhagavān etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and the Blessed One said to him:

original: “ahu pana te, bhāradvāja, māgaṇḍiyena paribbājakena saddhiṁ imaṁyeva tiṇasanthārakaṁ ārabbha kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti?
analyzed: ahu pana te bhāradvāja māgaṇḍiyena paribbājakena saddhim imayā iva tiṇa santhārakam ārabbha kocid eva kathā sallāpā iti
translated: “Brahmin, did you have some discussion with the wanderer Magandiya about this very grass mat?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhāradvājagotto brāhmaṇo saṁviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhāradvāja gottaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sa viggaḥ lomahaṭṭha jātaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin of the Bharadvaja clan, horrified, his hair standing on end, said to the Blessed One:

original: “etadeva kho pana mayaṁ bhoto gotamassa ārocetukāmā.
analyzed: etat eva khalu pana mayam bhotaḥ gotamassa ārocetu kāmā
translated: “We were just about to tell Master Gotama this.

original: Atha ca pana bhavaṁ gotamo anakkhātaṁyeva akkhāsī”ti.
analyzed: atha ca pana bhavam gotamaḥ an akkhātayā iva akkhāsi iti
translated: But still the reverend Gotama explains what has not been explained.”

original: Ayañca hi bhagavato bhāradvājagottena brāhmaṇena saddhiṁ antarākathā vippakatā hoti.🔽Atha kho māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako jaṅghāvihāraṁ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena bhāradvājagottassa
analyzed: ayam ca hi bhagavataḥ bhāradvāja gottena brāhmaṇena saddhim antarākathā vippakatā hoti  atha kho māgaṇḍiyaḥ paribbājakaḥ jaṅghāvihāram anucaṅkamamānaḥ anuvicaramānaḥ yena bhāradvājagottassa
translated: And this conversation between the Fortunate One and the brahmin of the Bhāradvāja clan came to an end.

original: brāhmaṇassa agyāgāraṁ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: brāhmaṇassa agyāgāram yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the wanderer Māgaṇḍiya, while walking and wandering for exercise, approached the fire-room of the brahmin of the Bhāradvāja clan, and after approaching he exchanged greetings with the Fortunate One.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho māgaṇḍiyaṁ paribbājakaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam kho māgaṇḍiyam paribbājakam bhagavān etat avoca
translated: After exchanging courteous talk and greetings he sat down on one side, and while he was sitting on one side the Fortunate One said this to the wanderer Māgaṇḍiya:

original: “Cakkhuṁ kho, māgaṇḍiya, rūpārāmaṁ rūparataṁ rūpasammuditaṁ.
analyzed: cakkhum kho māgaṇḍiya rūpa ārāmam rūpa ratam rūpa sammudita
translated: “The eye, Māgaṇḍiya, is delightful and enjoyable in relation to forms,

analyzed: tam tathāgatassa dantam guttam rakkhitam tassa ca savarāya dhammaṃ deseti
translated: but it is restrained, guarded, protected, and contained by the Realised One, and he teaches the Dhamma for restraint (of the senses),

analyzed: idam nu te eta māgaṇḍiya sandhāya bhāsita
translated: Is this what you were referring to, Māgaṇḍiya, when you said:

original: ‘bhūnahu samaṇo gotamo’”ti?
analyzed: bhūnahu samaṇaḥ gotama uti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is a speaker of the unborn’?”

original: “Etadeva kho pana me, bho gotama, sandhāya bhāsitaṁ:
analyzed: etat eva khalu pana me bho gotama sandhāya bhāsita
translated: “That’s what I meant when I said

original: ‘bhūnahu samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: bhūnahu samaṇaḥ gotama uti
translated: that the contemplative Gotama is a deceiver of the people.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Evañhi no sutte ocaratī”ti.
analyzed: evam hi no sutte ocarati iti
translated: That’s how it’s practiced in our tradition.”

original: “Sotaṁ kho, māgaṇḍiya, saddārāmaṁ …pe…🔽ghānaṁ kho, māgaṇḍiya gandhārāmaṁ …
analyzed: sotam kho māgaṇḍiya sadda ārāmam pe  ghānam khaḥ māgaṇḍiya gandha ārāmam
translated: “The ear, Māgaṇḍiya, delights in sounds …🔽The nose, Māgaṇḍiya, delights in aromas …

analyzed: jivhā kho māgaṇḍiya rasa ārāmā rasa ratā rasa sammuditā
translated: The tongue, Māgaṇḍiya, delights in tastes …

analyzed: sā tathāgatassa dantā guttā rakkhitā savutā tassā ca savarāya dhammaṃ deseti  idam nu te eta māgaṇḍiya sandhāya bhāsita
translated: The Tathāgata’s tongue is guarded, protected, & restrained. He teaches Dhamma with a tongue that is guarded, protected, & restrained.🔽Was that what you meant when you said

analyzed: bhūnahu samaṇaḥ gotama uti

translated: “That’s what I meant when I said

analyzed: mano kho māgaṇḍiya dhamma ārāmaḥ dhamma rataḥ dhamma sammudito
translated: The intellect, Māgaṇḍiya, delights in ideas, takes delight in ideas, rejoices in ideas.

analyzed: so tathāgatassa dantaḥ gutto rakkhito sa vutaḥ tassa ca savarāya dhammaṃ deseti
translated: He is controlled, guarded, restrained, and disciplined in regard to the Tathāgata’s instructions. And he teaches the Dhamma for the purpose of control, protection, restraint, and discipline.

analyzed: idam nu te eta māgaṇḍiya sandhāya bhāsita
translated: Was it with reference to this that you said:

analyzed: etat eva khalu pana me bho gotama sandhāya bhāsita
translated: “It was precisely with reference to this, Master Gotama, that I said:

original: ‘bhūnahu samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: bhūnahu samaṇaḥ gotama uti
translated: ‘The contemplative Gotama is a nihilist, one who teaches the annihilation, extermination, and ruin of an existing being.’

analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: Evañhi no sutte ocaratī”ti.
analyzed: evam hi no sutte ocarati iti
translated: Because that is how the statement occurs in our discourses.”

analyzed: tam kim maññasi māgaṇḍiya
translated: “What do you think, Magandiya?

original: ‘idhekacco cakkhuviññeyyehi rūpehi paricāritapubbo assa iṭṭhehi kantehi manāpehi🔽piyarūpehi kāmūpasaṁhitehi rajanīyehi, so aparena samayena rūpānaṁyeva samudayañca🔽atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā rūpataṇhaṁ pahāya
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ cakkhu viññeyyehi rūpehi paricāritapubbaḥ assa iṭṭhehi kantehi manāpehi  piya rūpehi kāma upasahitehi rajanīyehi saḥ aparena samayena samudayan ca  atthaṅgamam ca assādam ca ādīnavam ca nissaraṇam ca yathābhūtam viditvā rūpa taṇham pahāya
translated: Suppose someone had previously enjoyed himself with sights cognizable via the eye that are wished for, desirable, agreeable, pleasing, sensual, and arousing,

original: Imassa pana te, māgaṇḍiya, kimassa vacanīyan’”ti?
analyzed: imassa pana te māgaṇḍiya kimassa
translated: What would you say about him, Magandiya?”

original: “Na kiñci, bho gotama”.
analyzed: na kiñci bho gotama
translated: “Nothing, Master Gotama.”

analyzed: tam kim maññasi māgaṇḍiya
translated: “What do you think, Magandiya?

original: ‘idhekacco sotaviññeyyehi saddehi …pe…🔽ghānaviññeyyehi gandhehi …
analyzed: idha ekacco sota viññeyyehi saddehi pe  ghāna viññeyyehi gandhehi
translated: Suppose someone has previously enjoyed sounds cognizable by the ear …🔽smells cognizable by the nose …

original: jivhāviññeyyehi rasehi …
analyzed: jivhā viññeyyehi rasehi

analyzed: kāya viññeyyehi phoṭṭhabbehi paricāritapubbaḥ assa iṭṭhehi kantehi manāpehi piya rūpehi kāma upasahitehi rajanīyehi  so aparena samayena phoṭṭhabba anayā iva samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca
translated: touches cognizable by the body that are desirable, lovely, agreeable, pleasing, sensual, and tantalizing.🔽Later, having understood as they actually are the origin, the disappearance, the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of touches,

analyzed: nissaraṇam ca yathābhūtam viditvā phoṭṭhabba taṇham pahāya phoṭṭhabba pariḷāham paṭivinodetvā
translated: he might abandon craving for touches, might remove fever for touches,

analyzed: vigata pipāsaḥ ajjhattam vūpasanta cittaḥ vihareyya
translated: and might abide without thirst, with a mind inwardly at peace.

original: Sā etarahi anupubbena puthujjanagāthā.
analyzed: sā etarahi anupubbena puthujjana gāthā
translated: But now it has become a verse of the ordinary people.

original: Ayaṁ kho pana, māgaṇḍiya, kāyo rogabhūto gaṇḍabhūto sallabhūto aghabhūto ābādhabhūto, so tvaṁ imaṁ kāyaṁ rogabhūtaṁ gaṇḍabhūtaṁ sallabhūtaṁ aghabhūtaṁ ābādhabhūtaṁ:
analyzed: ayam khalu pana māgaṇḍiya kāyaḥ roga bhūtaḥ gaṇḍa bhūtaḥ salla bhūtaḥ agha bhūtaḥ ābādha bhūtaḥ saḥ tvam imam kāyam roga bhūtam gaṇḍa bhūtam salla bhūtam agha bhūtam ābādha bhūta
translated: But this body is a disease, a tumour, a dart, a calamity, and an affliction.

original: ‘idantaṁ, bho gotama, ārogyaṁ, idantaṁ nibbānan’ti vadesi.
analyzed: bho gotama ārogya idantam nibbānanti vadesi
translated: You say that this body is health and this is Nibbāna.

original: Tañhi te, māgaṇḍiya, ariyaṁ cakkhuṁ natthi yena tvaṁ ariyena cakkhunā ārogyaṁ jāneyyāsi, nibbānaṁ passeyyāsī”ti.
analyzed: tat hi te māgaṇḍiya ariyam cakkhum na atthi yena tvam ariyena cakkhunā ārogyam jāneyyāsi nibbānam passeyyāsi iti
translated: But you have no noble vision, Māgandiya, by which you could know health and see Nibbāna.”

original: “Evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ bhoto gotamassa.
analyzed: evam pasannaḥ aham bhoto gotamassa
translated: “I have confidence in Master Gotama thus:

original: Pahoti me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ yathāhaṁ ārogyaṁ jāneyyaṁ, nibbānaṁ passeyyan”ti.
analyzed: pahoti me bhavam gotamo tathā dhammam desetum yathā aham ārogyam jāneyya nibbānam passeyyanti
translated: Master Gotama is able to teach me the Dhamma in such a way that I could know health and see Nibbāna.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, māgaṇḍiya, jaccandho puriso;🔽so na passeyya kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni, na passeyya nīlakāni rūpāni, na passeyya pītakāni
analyzed: sā iyyathā api māgaṇḍiya jadcandho purisaḥ  saḥ na passeyya kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni na passeyya nīlakāni rūpāni na passeyya pītakāni
translated: “Māgandiya, suppose there were a man blind from birth🔽who could not see black objects…🔽who could not see white objects…

original: rūpāni, na passeyya lohitakāni rūpāni, na passeyya mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni, na passeyya
analyzed: rūpāni na passeyya lohitakāni rūpāni na passeyya mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni na passeyya
translated: who could not see blue…

original: samavisamaṁ, na passeyya tārakarūpāni, na passeyya candimasūriye.
analyzed: na passeyya tāraka rūpāni na passeyya candima sūriye
translated: he would not see the stars, he would not see the moon and sun.

original: Tassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā bhisakkaṁ sallakattaṁ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṁ.
analyzed: tassa mitta amaccāḥ ñāti sālohitāḥ bhisakkam sallakattam upaṭṭhāpeyyu
translated: His friends and companions, his kinsmen and relatives would get a doctor to treat him.

original: Tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: tassa saḥ bhisakkaḥ sallakatto bhesajjam kareyya
translated: The doctor would treat him with medicine.

original: So taṁ bhesajjaṁ āgamma na cakkhūni uppādeyya, na cakkhūni visodheyya.
analyzed: saḥ tam bhesajjam āgamma na cakkhūni uppādeyya na cakkhūni visodheyya
translated: But he would not recover his sight, he would not regain his sight.

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, māgaṇḍiya,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi māgaṇḍiya
translated: What do you think, Magandiya?

original: nanu so vejjo yāvadeva kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā”ti?
analyzed: nanu saḥ vejjaḥ yāvat eva kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assa ati
translated: Wouldn’t that doctor be working only for his own weariness and frustration?”

original: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: eva bho gotama
translated: “Yes, Master Gotama.”

original: “Evameva kho, māgaṇḍiya, ahañce te dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ:
analyzed: evam eva kho māgaṇḍiya aham ce te dhammam deseyya
translated: “So too, Magandiya, if I were to teach you the Dhamma thus:

original: ‘idantaṁ ārogyaṁ, idantaṁ nibbānan’ti, so tvaṁ ārogyaṁ na jāneyyāsi, nibbānaṁ na passeyyāsi.
analyzed: idantam ārogye idantam nibbānanti saḥ tvam ārogyam na jāneyyāsi nibbānam na passeyyāsi
translated: ‘This is that health, this is that Nibbana,’ you would not know it, you would not see it.

original: So mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā”ti.
analyzed: so mamassa kilamatho sā mamassa
translated: That would be a weariness and a trouble to me.”

original: “Evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ bhoto gotamassa.
analyzed: evam pasannaḥ aham bhoto gotamassa
translated: “I have confidence in Master Gotama thus:

original: Pahoti me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ yathāhaṁ ārogyaṁ jāneyyaṁ, nibbānaṁ passeyyan”ti.
analyzed: pahoti me bhavam gotamo tathā dhammam desetum yathā aham ārogyam jāneyya nibbānam passeyyanti
translated: It is possible that Master Gotama can teach me the Dhamma in such a way that I may know that health and see that Nibbana.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, māgaṇḍiya, jaccandho puriso;🔽so na passeyya kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni, na passeyya nīlakāni rūpāni, na passeyya pītakāni🔽rūpāni, na passeyya lohitakāni rūpāni, na passeyya mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni, na passeyya
analyzed: sā iyyathā api māgaṇḍiya jadcandho purisaḥ  saḥ na passeyya kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni na passeyya nīlakāni rūpāni na passeyya pītakāni  rūpāni na passeyya lohitakāni rūpāni na passeyya mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni na passeyya
translated: “Suppose, Māgaṇḍiya, there was a man blind from birth.🔽He would not see black and white forms, he would not see forms that are pleasant and unpleasant, he would not see the beautiful and the ugly,

original: samavisamaṁ, na passeyya tārakarūpāni, na passeyya candimasūriye.
analyzed: na passeyya tāraka rūpāni na passeyya candima sūriye
translated: he would not see the high and the low, he would not see the stars and the sun and moon.

original: So suṇeyya cakkhumato bhāsamānassa:
analyzed: so suṇeyya cakkhumataḥ bhāsamānassa
translated: He would hear a man with good eyesight saying:

original: ‘chekaṁ vata, bho, odātaṁ vatthaṁ abhirūpaṁ nimmalaṁ sucī’ti.
analyzed: chekam vata bho odātam vattham abhirūpam nimmalam suci iti
translated: ‘How beautiful is the white cloth, so lovely, so spotless, so clean!’

original: So odātapariyesanaṁ careyya.
analyzed: saḥ odāta pariyesanam careyya
translated: He would go in search of white cloth.

original: Tamenaṁ aññataro puriso telamalikatena sāhuḷicīrena vañceyya:
analyzed: tam enam aññataraḥ puriso telamalikatena sāhuḷi cīrena vañceyya
translated: Then a certain man would deceive him with a piece of glass, saying:

original: ‘idaṁ te, ambho purisa, odātaṁ vatthaṁ abhirūpaṁ nimmalaṁ sucī’ti.
analyzed: idam te ambho purisaḥ odātam vattham abhirūpam nimmalam suci iti
translated: ‘This, my good man, is white cloth, so lovely, so spotless, so clean.’

original: So taṁ paṭiggaṇheyya, paṭiggahetvā pārupeyya.
analyzed: saḥ tam paṭiggaṇheyya paṭiggahetvā pārupeyya
translated: He would accept it and put it on.

original: Tassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā bhisakkaṁ sallakattaṁ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṁ.
analyzed: tassa mitta amaccāḥ ñāti sālohitāḥ bhisakkam sallakattam upaṭṭhāpeyyu
translated: His friends, companions, kinsmen, and relatives would get a doctor to treat him.

original: Tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṁ kareyya—
analyzed: tassa saḥ bhisakkaḥ sallakatto bhesajjam kareyya
translated: The doctor would treat him with medicine—

original: uddhaṁvirecanaṁ adhovirecanaṁ añjanaṁ paccañjanaṁ natthukammaṁ.
analyzed: uddhavirecanam adhovirecanam añjanam paccañjanam natthukamma
translated: purgatives, emetics, eye medicine, nose treatment, surgery.

original: So taṁ bhesajjaṁ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.
analyzed: saḥ tam bhesajjam āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya cakkhūni visodheyya
translated: And he would regain his sight and his eyes would be purified.

original: Tassa saha cakkhuppādā yo amusmiṁ telamalikate sāhuḷicīre chandarāgo so pahīyetha.
analyzed: tassa saha cakkhu ppādā yaḥ amusmin telamalikate sāhuḷicīre chanda rāgaḥ saḥ pahīyetha
translated: And with the arising of his sight, whatever desire and greed he had for the oil-seed cake and the coarse hemp cloth would be given up.

original: Tañca naṁ purisaṁ amittatopi daheyya, paccatthikatopi daheyya, api ca jīvitā voropetabbaṁ maññeyya:
analyzed: tat ca nam purisam amittataḥ api daheyya paccatthikataḥ api daheyya api ca jīvitā voropetabbam maññeyya
translated: And he would think of burning that man as an enemy, as a foe, and would even think of killing him:

original: ‘dīgharattaṁ vata, bho, ahaṁ iminā purisena telamalikatena sāhuḷicīrena nikato vañcito paluddho—
analyzed: dīgharattam vata bho aham iminā purisena telamalikatena sāhuḷicīrena nikataḥ vañcitaḥ paluddhaḥ
translated: ‘For a long time, sir, I have been deceived, cheated, and tricked by this man with his oil-seed cake and his coarse hemp cloth.

original: idaṁ te, ambho purisa, odātaṁ vatthaṁ abhirūpaṁ nimmalaṁ sucī’ti.
analyzed: idam te ambho purisaḥ odātam vattham abhirūpam nimmalam suci iti
translated: This is your white cloth, sir, beautiful, spotless, and clean.’

original: Evameva kho, māgaṇḍiya, ahañce te dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ:
analyzed: evam eva kho māgaṇḍiya aham ce te dhammam deseyya
translated: “In the same way, Magandiya, if I were to teach you the Dhamma,

original: ‘idantaṁ ārogyaṁ, idantaṁ nibbānan’ti.
analyzed: idantam ārogye idantam nibbānanti
translated: saying, ‘This is health, this is Nibbana,’

original: So tvaṁ ārogyaṁ jāneyyāsi, nibbānaṁ passeyyāsi.
analyzed: saḥ tvam ārogyam jāneyyāsi nibbānam passeyyāsi
translated: you would know health and see Nibbana.

original: Tassa te saha cakkhuppādā yo pañcasupādānakkhandhesu chandarāgo so pahīyetha;
analyzed: tassa te saha cakkhuppādāḥ yaḥ pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chanda rāgaḥ saḥ pahīyetha
translated: And with the arising of your sight, whatever desire and greed you have for the five aggregates affected by clinging would be given up.

original: api ca te evamassa:
analyzed: api ca te
translated: But you might think:

original: ‘dīgharattaṁ vata bho ahaṁ iminā cittena nikato vañcito paluddho.🔽Ahañhi rūpaṁyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṁ, vedanaṁyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṁ, saññaṁyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṁ, saṅkhāreyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṁ, viññāṇaṁyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṁ.
analyzed: dīgharattam vata bho aham iminā cittena nikataḥ vañcitaḥ paluddhaḥ  aham hi rūpayā iva upādiyamānaḥ vedanayā iva upādiyamānaḥ upādiyi saññayā iva upādiyamānaḥ upādiyi saṅkhāreya iva upādiyamānaḥ upādiyi viññāṇayā iva upādiyamānaḥ upādiyi
translated: ‘For a long time I have been bound, deceived, and misled by this mind.🔽For I have been clinging to form, clinging to feeling, clinging to perception, clinging to choices, clinging to consciousness.

original: Tassa me upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā sambhavanti;
analyzed: tassa me upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ bhava paccayā jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇam soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā sambhavanti
translated: Because of clinging, there is becoming. Because of becoming, there is birth. Because of birth, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress come into play.

original: evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hotī’”ti.
analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti iti
translated: Such is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.’

original: “Evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ bhoto gotamassa.
analyzed: evam pasannaḥ aham bhoto gotamassa
translated: “I have confidence in Master Gotama thus.

original: Pahoti me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ yathāhaṁ imamhā āsanā anandho vuṭṭhaheyyan”ti.
analyzed: pahoti me bhavam gotamo tathā dhammam desetum yathā aham imamhā āsanā an andhaḥ vuṭṭhaheyyanti
translated: Master Gotama is capable of teaching me the Dhamma in such a way that I might get to rise up from this seat without being blind.”

original: “Tena hi tvaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, sappurise bhajeyyāsi.
analyzed: tena hi tva māgaṇḍiya sappurise bhajeyyāsi
translated: “Well now, Magandiya, you should associate with true people.

original: Yato kho tvaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, sappurise bhajissasi tato tvaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, saddhammaṁ sossasi;🔽yato kho tvaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, saddhammaṁ sossasi tato tvaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, dhammānudhammaṁ paṭipajjissasi;
analyzed: yatas kho tva māgaṇḍiya sappurise bhajissasi tatas tva māgaṇḍiya saddhammam sossasi  yatas kho tva māgaṇḍiya saddhammam sossasi tatas tva māgaṇḍiya dhamma anudhammam paṭipajjissasi
translated: When you associate with good people, you will hear the true Teaching.🔽When you hear the true Teaching, you will practice in line with the Teaching.

original: yato kho tvaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, dhammānudhammaṁ paṭipajjissasi tato tvaṁ, māgaṇḍiya, sāmaṁyeva ñassasi, sāmaṁ dakkhissasi—
analyzed: yatas kho tva māgaṇḍiya dhamma anudhammam paṭipajjissasi tatas tva māgaṇḍiya sāmayā iva ñassasi sāmam dakkhissasi
translated: When you practice in line with the Teaching, you will know and see for yourself—

original: ime rogā gaṇḍā sallā;
analyzed: ime rogāḥ gaṇḍā sallā
translated: ‘These are the sicknesses, abscesses, and thorns,

original: idha rogā gaṇḍā sallā aparisesā nirujjhanti.
analyzed: idha rogā gaṇḍā sallā aparisesā nirujjhanti
translated: and right here they cease without anything left over.’

original: Tassa me upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā nirujjhanti;
analyzed: tassa me upādāna nirodhā bhava nirodhaḥ bhava nirodhā jāti nirodhaḥ jāti nirodhā jarā maraṇam soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsāḥ nirujjhanti
translated: When there is no grasping, there is no becoming. When there is no becoming, there is no birth. When there is no birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress end.

original: evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodho hotī”ti.
analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodhaḥ hoti iti
translated: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte māgaṇḍiyaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the wanderer Magandiya said to the Buddha,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: “Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent!🔽As if he were righting the overturned,🔽or revealing the hidden,🔽or pointing out the path to the lost,🔽or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there,

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: Just as one might restore what has been overturned,

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: reveal what is hidden, show the way to one who is lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what is there—

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has the Lord Gotama in many a figure expounded the Dhamma.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to the Lord Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Labheyyāhaṁ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.🔽“Yo kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṁ, ākaṅkhati
analyzed: labheyya aham bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti  yaḥ kho māgaṇḍiya añña titthiya pubbaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajje ākaṅkhati
translated: May the Lord Gotama accept me as a lay-follower gone to him for refuge, from this day forth for as long as life lasts.

original: upasampadaṁ, so cattāro māse parivasati; catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū
analyzed: upasampadā saḥ cattāraḥ māse parivasati catunnam māsānam accayena āraddha cittāḥ bhikkhū
translated: “Magandiya, anyone who has been a monastic of another sect and who wishes for ordination in this Dhamma and Discipline must train for four months on probation.

original: pabbājenti, upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya.
analyzed: pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhu bhāvāya
translated: If the bhikkhus are satisfied with him, they give him ordination.

original: Api ca mettha puggalavemattatā viditā”ti.
analyzed: api ca mā ittha puggala vematta tā viditā ati
translated: But here, Magandiya, the worth of the individual is discerned.”

original: “Sace, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbā imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhantā pabbajjaṁ, ākaṅkhantā🔽upasampadaṁ cattāro māse parivasanti, catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū🔽pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya; ahaṁ cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi, catunnaṁ
analyzed: sace bhante añña titthiya pubbā imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhantā pabbajje ākaṅkhantā  upasampadam cattāraḥ māse parivasanti catunnam māsānam accayena āraddha cittāḥ bhikkhū  pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhu bhāvāya aham cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi
translated: “If those who were formerly of another sect and who wish to be fully admitted into this Dhamma and Discipline🔽must train for four months on probation, and then request the full ordination from the monks,

original: vassānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājentu, upasampādentu bhikkhubhāvāyā”ti.
analyzed: vassānaṃ accayena āraddha cittāḥ bhikkhū pabbājentu upasampādentu bhikkhu bhāvāya ati
translated: then I will train for four years on probation, and then request the full ordination from the monks.”

original: Alattha kho māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.🔽Acirūpasampanno kho panāyasmā māgaṇḍiyo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto
analyzed: alattha kho māgaṇḍiyaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavato santike pabbajja alattha upasampada  acira upasampannaḥ kho pana āyasmā māgaṇḍiyaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitatto
translated: And Māgaṇḍiya received the going forth in the presence of the Buddha, he received the full ordination.🔽Soon after his full ordination, while still young and black-haired,🔽not long after his full ordination,

original: viharanto nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti,
analyzed: viharantaḥ kula puttā sammad eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti
translated: he directly experienced the supreme end of the spiritual life for which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness,

original: tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
analyzed: tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosānam diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: and he understood: “Destroyed is birth, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming back to any state of being.”🔽And Venerable Māgaṇḍiya became another one of the arahants.

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.🔽Aññataro kho panāyasmā māgaṇḍiyo arahataṁ ahosīti.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati  aññataraḥ kho pana ayasmai māgaṇḍiyaḥ arahatam ahosi iti
translated: He directly experienced the reward of freedom.

original: Māgaṇḍiyasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: māgaṇḍiya suttam niṭṭhitam pañcama
translated: And Venerable Māgaṇḍiya became another one of the perfected ones.
